content:
ModelStateDictionary Class

In this Article

Represents the state of model binding.

Syntax

Declaration

public class ModelStateDictionary : System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<string,System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelState>>, System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelState>, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<string,System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelState>>

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ModelStateDictionary

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Constructors summary

ModelStateDictionary()

Initializes a new instance of the ModelStateDictionary class.
ModelStateDictionary(ModelStateDictionary)

Initializes a new instance of the ModelStateDictionary class using an existing dictionary collection.

Properties summary

Count

Gets the number of key/value pairs in the collection.
IsReadOnly

Gets a value that indicates whether the dictionary is read-only.
IsValid

Gets a value that indicates whether there are any errors in any of the model state objects in the dictionary.
Item(String)

Gets or sets the value that is associated with the specified key.
Keys

Gets a collection that contains the keys of the dictionary.
Values

Gets a collection that contains the values of the dictionary.

Methods summary

Add(KeyValuePair<String,ModelState>)

Adds the specified item to the dictionary.
Add(String,ModelState)

Adds an item that has the specified key and value to the dictionary.
AddModelError(String,Exception)

Adds a model error to the errors collection using the specified key and using the specified exception for the value.
AddModelError(String,String)

Adds the specified model error to the errors collection using the specified key and using the specified error message string for the value.
Clear()

Removes all items from the dictionary.
Contains(KeyValuePair<String,ModelState>)

Determines whether the model-state dictionary contains a specific item.
ContainsKey(String)

Determines whether the model-state dictionary contains the specified key.
CopyTo(KeyValuePair<String,ModelState>[],Int32)

Copies the elements of the dictionary to an array, starting at a specified index.
GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the dictionary.
IsValidField(String)

Determines whether there are any ModelError objects that are associated with the specified key or that are prefixed with the specified key.
Merge(ModelStateDictionary)

Copies the values from the specified model-state dictionary object into this dictionary, overwriting existing values if the keys are the same.
Remove(KeyValuePair<String,ModelState>)

Removes the first occurrence of the specified item from the model-state dictionary.
Remove(String)

Removes the item that has the specified key from the dictionary.
SetModelValue(String,ValueProviderResult)

Sets the value for the specified key.
TryGetValue(String,ModelState)

Attempts to gets the value that is associated with the specified key.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

    Initializes a new instance of the ModelStateDictionary class.

    public ModelStateDictionary ();
  • ModelStateDictionary(ModelStateDictionary)

    Initializes a new instance of the ModelStateDictionary class using an existing dictionary collection.

    public ModelStateDictionary (System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelStateDictionary dictionary);

    Parameters

    • dictionary
      ModelStateDictionary

      The dictionary.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The dictionary parameter is null.

Properties

  • Count

    Gets the number of key/value pairs in the collection.

    public int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of key/value pairs in the collection.

  • IsReadOnly

    Gets a value that indicates whether the dictionary is read-only.

    public bool IsReadOnly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the dictionary is read-only; otherwise, false.

  • IsValid

    Gets a value that indicates whether there are any errors in any of the model state objects in the dictionary.

    public bool IsValid { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      false if any errors were found; otherwise, true.

  • Item(String)

    Gets or sets the value that is associated with the specified key.

    public System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelState this[string key] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The key.

    Property Value

    • ModelState

      The item.

  • Keys

    Gets a collection that contains the keys of the dictionary.

    public System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<string> Keys { get; }

    Property Value

    • ICollection<String>

      The keys of the dictionary.

  • Values

    Gets a collection that contains the values of the dictionary.

    public System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelState> Values { get; }

    Property Value

    • ICollection<ModelState>

      The values of the dictionary.

  • Add(KeyValuePair<String,ModelState>)

    Parameters

      String

      The key.

    • exception
      Exception

      The exception object.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The key parameter is null.

  • AddModelError(String,String)

    Adds the specified model error to the errors collection using the specified key and using the specified error message string for the value.

    public void AddModelError (string key, string errorMessage);

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The key.

    • errorMessage
      String

      The error message.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The key parameter is null.

  • Clear()

    Removes all items from the dictionary.

    public void Clear ();
  • Contains(KeyValuePair<String,ModelState>)

    Determines whether the model-state dictionary contains a specific item.

    public bool Contains (System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<string,System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelState> item);

    Parameters

    • item
      KeyValuePair<String,ModelState>

      The item to locate in the model-state dictionary.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if item is found in the dictionary; otherwise, false.

  • ContainsKey(String)

    Determines whether the model-state dictionary contains the specified key.

    public bool ContainsKey (string key);

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The key.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the dictionary contains the specified key; otherwise, false.

  • CopyTo(KeyValuePair<String,ModelState>[],Int32)

    Copies the elements of the dictionary to an array, starting at a specified index.

    public void CopyTo (System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<string,System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelState>[] array, int arrayIndex);

    Parameters

    • array
      KeyValuePair<String,ModelState>[]

      The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the dictionary. The array must have zero-based indexing.

    • arrayIndex
      Int32

      The zero-based index in array at which copying starts.

  • GetEnumerator()

    Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the dictionary.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator<System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<string,System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelState>> GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerator<KeyValuePair<String,ModelState>>

      An enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

  • IsValidField(String)

    Determines whether there are any ModelError objects that are associated with the specified key or that are prefixed with the specified key.

    public bool IsValidField (string key);

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The key.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if any ModelError objects are associated with the specified key or prefixed with the specified key; otherwise, false. If the key is not found in the dictionary, this method returns true.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The key parameter is null.

  • Merge(ModelStateDictionary)

    Copies the values from the specified model-state dictionary object into this dictionary, overwriting existing values if the keys are the same.

    public void Merge (System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelStateDictionary dictionary);

    Parameters

    • dictionary
      ModelStateDictionary

      The model-state dictionary to be merged into this one.

  • Remove(KeyValuePair<String,ModelState>)

    Removes the first occurrence of the specified item from the model-state dictionary.

    public bool Remove (System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<string,System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelState> item);

    Parameters

    • item
      KeyValuePair<String,ModelState>

      The item to remove.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the item was successfully removed from the dictionary, or false if the item was not removed or was not found in the dictionary.

  • Remove(String)

    Removes the item that has the specified key from the dictionary.

    public bool Remove (string key);

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The key of the item to remove.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the item was successfully removed from the dictionary, or false if the item was not removed or was not found in the dictionary.

  • SetModelValue(String,ValueProviderResult)

    Sets the value for the specified key.

    public void SetModelValue (string key, System.Web.ModelBinding.ValueProviderResult value);

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The key.

    • value
      ValueProviderResult

      The value.

  • TryGetValue(String,ModelState)

    Attempts to gets the value that is associated with the specified key.

    public bool TryGetValue (string key, out System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelState value);

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The key of the value to get.

    • value
      ModelState

      When this method returns, contains the value that is associated with the specified key, if the key was found; otherwise, contains the default value for the type of this parameter. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the dictionary contains an item that has the specified key; otherwise, false.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

    Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

    System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerator

      An enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

    Remarks

    This is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ModelStateDictionary instance is cast to an IEnumerable interface.
